name: Dijkstra's Algorithm
description: An algorithm used to find the shortest path between nodes in a weighted graph, ensuring the minimum total distance from a source node to all others.

name: A* Search
description: A pathfinding algorithm that uses heuristics and cost functions to efficiently find the shortest route from a start point to a goal point.

name: Depth-First Search
description: A graph traversal algorithm that explores as far as possible along each branch before backtracking, typically implemented using recursion or a stack.

name: Kruskal's Algorithm
description: An algorithm for finding the minimum spanning tree of a graph by sorting edges by weight and adding them one by one while avoiding cycles.
